metadata.Title: CVE-2012-6707 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
WordPress through 4.8.2 uses a weak MD5-based password hashing algorithm,which makes it easier for attackers to determine cleartext values byleveraging access to the hash values. NOTE: the approach to changing thismay not be fully compatible with certain use cases, such as migration of aWordPress site from a web host that uses a recent PHP version to adifferent web host that uses PHP 5.2. These use cases are plausible (butvery unlikely) based on statistics showing widespread deployment ofWordPress with obsolete PHP versions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6707` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.9.7+dfsg1-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.9.7+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentynineteen - 4.9.7+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentyseventeen - 4.9.7+dfsg1-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 4.9.7+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.9.7+dfsg1-1').
